title: Inductor - mag permeability of inductor cores

content.question: The inductance of an inductor when two cores, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, are inserted into the inductor is <math alttext="L sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="L sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, respectively. Both cores completely fill the inductor. If <math alttext="L sub A equals 2 L sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, what claim can be made about the two cores?

choices.label: The resistivity of Core <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is greater than that of Core <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>.

The resistivity Core <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is less than that of Core <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>.

The magnetic permeability of Core <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is greater than that of Core <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>.

The magnetic permeability of Core <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is less than that of Core <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>.

content.answer: The magnetic permeability of Core <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is greater than that of Core <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
